gurmukhi: ਹਹਰੰਤ ਹਯੰ ਗਰਜੰਤ ਗਜੰ || ਸੁਣ ਕੈ ਧੁਨ ਸਾਵਣ ਮੇਘ ਲਜੰ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Hahrant Hayan Gadjant Gadan|| Soun Kai Dhoun Saavan Megh Lajan||15||
translation: Hearing the neighing of horses and the trumpeting of the elephants, the clouds of Sawan felt shy.15.

gurmukhi: ਬਰਖੈ ਰਣ ਬਾਣ ਕਮਾਣ ਖਗੰ || ਤਹ ਘੋਰ ਭਯਾਨਕ ਜੁੱਧ ਜਗੰ ||
transliteration: Bakhai Ran Baan Kamaan Khagadg|| Tah Ghor Bhayaanak Juddh Jagadg||
translation: The arrows and the swords were showered in the war and in this may this war was a dreadful and horrible war.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰ ਜਾਤ ਭਟੰ ਹਹਰੰਤ ਹਠੀ || ੳੁਮਗੀ ਰਿਪ ਸੈਣ ਕੀੲੇ ੲਿਕਠੀ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Gir Jaat Bhatan Hathee|| Oumgirip Sain Keee Ikathee||16||
translation: The warriors fall, but in their persistence, they raise dreadful sound. In this way, the forces of the enemy, gathered quickly from all the four sides in the battlefield.16.

gurmukhi: ਚਹੂੰ ਓਰ ਘਿਰਯੋ ਸਰ ਸੋਧਿ ਸਿਵੰ || ਕਰਿ ਕੋਪ ਘਨੋ ਅਸੁਰਾਰ ੲਿਵੰ ||
transliteration: Chahoon Or Ghiryo Sar Sodh(i) Sivan|| Kar(i) Kop Ghano Asuraar Ivan||
translation: Having been besieged from all the for sides, held his arrow and flew into rage over the demons.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਹੂੰ ਓਰਨ ਤੇ ੲਿਮ ਬਾਣ ਬਹੇ || ਨਭ ਅੳੁਰ ਧਰਾ ਦੋੳੂ ਛਾੲਿ ਰਹੇ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Duhoon Oran Te Im Baan Bahe|| Nabh Aur Dharaa Dooo Chhaad Rahe||17||
translation: The arrows were showered so intensely from both the sides, that there was shade on the earth and over the sky.17.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਗੇ ਤਹ ਟੋਪਨਿ ਟੂਕ ਘਨੇ || ਰਹਗੇ ਜਨ ਕਿੰਸਕ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਸਨੇ ||
transliteration: Girge Tah Topan(i) Took Ghane|| Rahge Jan Kinsak Sron Sane||
translation: The helmets broke and fell in eh battlefield like the flowers saturated with blood.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਹੇਰ ਅਗੰਮ ਅਨੂਪ ਹਰੰ || ਜੀਯ ਮੋ ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤ ਬਿਚਾਰ ਕਰੰ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Ran Her Agadm Haran|| Jeeya Mo Eh Bhaant Bichaar Karan||18||
translation: The unapproachable and unique Shiva thought over in this way in his mind.18.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਯ ਮੋ ਸਿਵ ਦੋਖ ਰਹਾ ਚਕ ਕੈ || ਦਲ ਦੈਤਨ ਮੱਧਿ ਪਰਾ ਹਕ ਕੈ ||
transliteration: Jeeya Mo Siv Dekh Rahaa Chak Kai|| Dal Daitan Maddh(i) Paraa Hak Kai||
translation: And perplexed in his heart, Shiva, shouting loudly, jumped into the forces of the demons.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਸੂਲ ਸੰਭਾਰ ਪ੍ਹਾਰ ਕਰੰ || ਸੁਣਕੈ ਧੁਨਿ ਦੇਵ ਅਦੇਵ ਡਰੰ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Ran Sool Sanbhaar Prahaar Karan|| Soun-kaidhoun(i) Dev Adev Daran||19||
translation: Holding his trident, he began to strike blows and hearing the sound of his blows, both the gods and demons were all filled with fear.19.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਯ ਮੋ ਸਿਵ ਧਯਾਨ ਧਰਾ ਜਬ ਹੀ || ਕਲ ਕਾਲ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਨਿ ਭੲੇ ਤਬ ਹੀ ||
transliteration: Jeeya Mo Siv Dhyan Dharaa Jab Hee|| Kal Kaal Prasann(i) Bhae Tab Hee||
translation: When Shiva meditated in his mind on the non-temporal Lord, the Lord was pleased at the same time.

gurmukhi: ਕਹਯੋ ਬਿਸਨ ਜਲੰਧਰ ਰੂਪ ਧਰੋ || ਪੁਨਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਰਿਪੇਸ ਕੋ ਨਾਸ ਕਰੋ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Kahyo Bisan Jalandhar Roop Daro|| Poun(i) Jaae Ripes Ko Naasdaro||20||
translation: Vishnu was ordered to manifest himself as Jalndhar and in this way destroy the king of enemies.20.

gurmukhi: ਦੲੀ ਕਾਲ ਅਾਗਯਾ ਧਰਿਯੋ ਬਿਸਨ ਰੂਪੰ || ਸਜੇ ਸਾਜ ਸਰਬੰ ਬਨਿਯੋ ਜਾਨ ਭੂਪੰ ||
transliteration: Daikaal Aagyaa Dhariyo Bisan Roopan|| Saje Saaj Saraban Baniyo Jaan Bhoopan||
translation: The Destroyer Lord commanded and Vishnu manifested himself in the form of Jalandhar, and bedecked in all manner, he appeared as a kiing.
